alert.note: Alert for Central and South Weld County; Larimer County Below 6000 Feet, Northwest Weld County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 27 at 3:23PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Weld and east central Larimer Counties through 415 PM MDT... At 323 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms capable of producing a landspout tornado along a line extending from near Wellington to 4 miles south of Windsor to 3 miles south of Johnstown, or along a line extending from 10 miles northeast of Fort Collins to 9 miles west of Greeley to 38 miles north of Denver. Movement was northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Landspouts possible, winds in excess of 40 mph, and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Landspout tornadoes can damage mobile homes, roofs, vehicles, and trees. Outdoor objects may be tossed about. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Eastern Fort Collins, Greeley, northeastern Loveland, Windsor, Evans, Johnstown, Wellington, Milliken, Berthoud, Eaton, Mead, Severance, Platteville, LaSalle, Ault, Gilcrest, Pierce, Timnath and Nunn. LANDSPOUT...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. If a tornado is spotted seek shelter inside a sturdy building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM MDT for northeastern Colorado.

area.areaDesc: Central and South Weld County; Larimer County Below 6000 Feet, Northwest Weld County
